alert.note: Alert for Conway; Pope; Van Buren (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 9:07PM CDT until July 31 at 12:10AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Conway County in central Arkansas... East Central Pope County in central Arkansas... Southwestern Van Buren County in north central Arkansas... * Until 1210 AM CDT. * At 907 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jerusalem, Blick, Cleveland, Appleton, Macedonia in Conway County and Wonderview. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
